newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's diamond exports up 36 pct in October.
newsitem.headline: Israel's diamond exports up 36 pct in October.

text.p: Israel's net exports of polished diamonds in October rose 36 percent to $421 million from $309 million a year earlier, the Industry and Trade Ministry said.
In the first 10 months of the year exports of polished diamonds rose six percent to $3.4 billion from $3.2 billion.
In the same period, exports of uncut diamonds grew 16 percent to $660 million from $570 million.
The United States, Japan, Hong Kong and Belgium accounted for 86 percent of Israel's exports.
